hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by a man whose uncle is Abu al-Ahwas, who said: I came to the Prophet ﷺ, and he looked at me carefully, up and down. Then he said: 'Are you a master of camels or of sheep?' I said: 'No, Allah Most High has given me both abundance and goodness.' Then he said: 'Do you not produce them with their ears and eyes intact and then you cut off this one and slaughter that one as sacrificial animal and dedicated one? The Hand of Allah is stronger and His sword is sharper.'

I said: 'The one who does not hide from me.' He said: 'Verily, you are likewise before your Lord.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by [a companion]: I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ while I was in a poor state of appearance. He said: 'Do you have wealth?' I said: 'Yes.'
